alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Morris; Somerset; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 22 at 7:24PM EDT until April 22 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Hunterdon County in northwestern New Jersey... Central Morris County in northern New Jersey... Southeastern Sussex County in northwestern New Jersey... East central Warren County in northwestern New Jersey... Northwestern Somerset County in northern New Jersey... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 724 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lebanon, or 12 miles northwest of Somerville, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Newton, Dover, Hopatcong, Hackettstown, Wharton, Rockaway, Mount Arlington, Franklin, Mendham, High Bridge, Stanhope, Hamburg, Netcong, Clinton, Peapack And Gladstone, Ogdensburg, Chester, Victory Gardens, Lebanon and Califon. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 16 and 30. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 19 and 37. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
